summary: "ER" is an American TV show about a hospital's emergency room, created by Michael Crichton. It aired on NBC from 1994 to 2009, with 331 episodes over 15 seasons. The series followed doctors, nurses, and staff as they handled medical emergencies and personal challenges. "ER" is one of the longest-running medical dramas and has won many awards, including a Peabody Award and an Emmy for Outstanding Drama Series. It's considered one of the best medical shows ever, making over $3 billion and inspiring other medical dramas.
title: ER (TV series)
